TypeSignature.Value: Public MustInherit Class Handler Inherits Object
public ref class Handler abstract : Java::Lang::Object
.class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit Handler extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: A Handler object takes log messages from a Logger and exports them.

remarks.para: A Handler object takes log messages from a Logger and exports them. It might for example, write them to a console or write them to a file, or send them to a network logging service, or forward them to an OS log, or whatever.
A Handler can be disabled by doing a setLevel(Level.OFF) and can be re-enabled by doing a setLevel with an appropriate level.
Handler classes typically use LogManager properties to set default values for the Handler's Filter, Formatter, and Level. See the specific documentation for each concrete Handler class.
Added in 1.4.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

remarks.para: Default constructor. The resulting Handler has a log level of Level.ALL, no Formatter, and no Filter. A default ErrorManager instance is installed as the ErrorManager.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride Sub Close ()
public: abstract void Close();
public abstract void Close ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Close() cil managed
abstract member Close : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Close the Handler and free all associated resources.

remarks.para: Close the Handler and free all associated resources.

The close method will perform a flush and then close the Handler. After close has been called this Handler should no longer be used. Method calls may either be silently ignored or may throw runtime exceptions.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: The name of a supported character encoding. May be null, to indicate the default platform encoding.
Docs.summary: Return the character encoding for this Handler. -or- Set the character encoding used by this Handler.
Docs.value: The encoding name. May be null, which indicates the default encoding should be used.

remarks.para: Property getter documentation:
Return the character encoding for this Handler.
Property setter documentation:
Set the character encoding used by this Handler.
The encoding should be set before any LogRecords are written to the Handler.

Docs.summary: Retrieves the ErrorManager for this Handler. -or- Define an ErrorManager for this Handler.

remarks.para: Property getter documentation:
Retrieves the ErrorManager for this Handler.
Property setter documentation:
Define an ErrorManager for this Handler.
The ErrorManager's "error" method will be invoked if any errors occur while using this Handler.

member this.Filter : Java.Util.Logging.IFilter with get, set

Docs.summary: Get the current Filter for this Handler. -or- Set a Filter to control output on this Handler.

remarks.para: Property getter documentation:
Get the current Filter for this Handler.
Property setter documentation:
Set a Filter to control output on this Handler.
For each call of publish the Handler will call this Filter (if it is non-null) to check if the LogRecord should be published or discarded.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: the Formatter to use (may not be null)
Docs.summary: Return the Formatter for this Handler. -or- Set a Formatter.

remarks.para: Property getter documentation:
Return the Formatter for this Handler.
Property setter documentation:
Set a Formatter. This Formatter will be used to format LogRecords for this Handler.
Some Handlers may not use Formatters, in which case the Formatter will be remembered, but not used.

abstract member IsLoggable : Java.Util.Logging.LogRecord -> bool override this.IsLoggable : Java.Util.Logging.LogRecord -> bool

Docs.summary: Check if this Handler would actually log a given LogRecord.
Docs.returns: true if the LogRecord would be logged.

remarks.para: Check if this Handler would actually log a given LogRecord.

This method checks if the LogRecord has an appropriate Level and whether it satisfies any Filter. It also may make other Handler specific checks that might prevent a handler from logging the LogRecord. It will return false if the LogRecord is null.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Property Level As Level
public: virtual property Java::Util::Logging::Level ^ Level { Java::Util::Logging::Level ^ get(); void set(Java::Util::Logging::Level ^ value); };
public virtual Java.Util.Logging.Level? Level { get; set; }
.property instance class Java.Util.Logging.Level Level
member this.Level : Java.Util.Logging.Level with get, set

Docs.param: the new value for the log level
Docs.summary: Get the log level specifying which messages will be logged by this Handler. -or- Set the log level specifying which message levels will be logged by this Handler.
Docs.value: the level of messages being logged.

remarks.para: Property getter documentation:
Get the log level specifying which messages will be logged by this Handler. Message levels lower than this level will be discarded.
Property setter documentation:
Set the log level specifying which message levels will be logged by this Handler. Message levels lower than this value will be discarded.
The intention is to allow developers to turn on voluminous logging, but to limit the messages that are sent to certain Handlers.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride Sub Publish (record As LogRecord)
public: abstract void Publish(Java::Util::Logging::LogRecord ^ record);
public abstract void Publish (Java.Util.Logging.LogRecord? record);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Publish(class Java.Util.Logging.LogRecord record) cil managed
abstract member Publish : Java.Util.Logging.LogRecord -> unit

Docs.param: description of the log event. A null record is silently ignored and is not published

remarks.para: Publish a LogRecord.
The logging request was made initially to a Logger object, which initialized the LogRecord and forwarded it here.
The Handler is responsible for formatting the message, when and if necessary. The formatting should include localization.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: an error code defined in ErrorManager
Docs.summary: Protected convenience method to report an error to this Handler's ErrorManager.

remarks.para: Protected convenience method to report an error to this Handler's ErrorManager. Note that this method retrieves and uses the ErrorManager without doing a security check. It can therefore be used in environments where the caller may be non-privileged.
